values.description:
We often have to trigger bottle building jenkins jobs, and the pull request branch parameter doesn't need to be set if we can just query it from the github API.

We should test this before merging.
values.title: Extract pull request branch name from github API instead of passing it as a parameter

summary.raw:
We often have to trigger bottle building jenkins jobs, and the pull request branch parameter doesn't need to be set if we can just query it from the github API.

We should test this before merging.
summary.html:
We often have to trigger bottle building jenkins jobs, and the pull request branch parameter doesn't need to be set if we can just query it from the github API.

We should test this before merging.

values.description:
The upstream ABI checker script has a parsing error on xenial:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/88/console

~~~
+ abi-compliance-checker -lib gazebo -old pkg.xml -new devel.xml
syntax error at /usr/bin/abi-compliance-checker line 819, near ""\n\n";"
Execution of /usr/bin/abi-compliance-checker aborted due to compilation errors.
~~~

It was introduced recently onto the master branch:

* https://github.com/lvc/abi-compliance-checker/commit/26742a8c630e5dd42838a8c2faf4bb4f8e59c393

The workaround is to checkout a tag instead of using the master branch.
values.title: Use abi-compliance-checker tag instead of master

summary.raw:
The upstream ABI checker script has a parsing error on xenial:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/88/console

~~~
+ abi-compliance-checker -lib gazebo -old pkg.xml -new devel.xml
syntax error at /usr/bin/abi-compliance-checker line 819, near ""\n\n";"
Execution of /usr/bin/abi-compliance-checker aborted due to compilation errors.
~~~

It was introduced recently onto the master branch:

* https://github.com/lvc/abi-compliance-checker/commit/26742a8c630e5dd42838a8c2faf4bb4f8e59c393

The workaround is to checkout a tag instead of using the master branch.
summary.html:
The upstream ABI checker script has a parsing error on xenial:

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/88/console
+ abi-compliance-checker -lib gazebo -old pkg.xml -new devel.xml
syntax error at /usr/bin/abi-compliance-checker line 819, near ""\n\n";"
Execution of /usr/bin/abi-compliance-checker aborted due to compilation errors.

It was introduced recently onto the master branch:

  • https://github.com/lvc/abi-compliance-checker/commit/26742a8c630e5dd42838a8c2faf4bb4f8e59c393

The workaround is to checkout a tag instead of using the master branch.

values.description:
Refactor the `_github_setup` to only create the github local checkout and use a new `_github_get_formula_hash` to keep the previous behaviour working.

I changed the `homebrew_bottle_pullrequest` script to iterate over the json files and call the commit on each one. PACKAGE_ALIAS and VERSION have been overwritten by the json variables.
values.title: Brew: support for multiple json files in PR updater

summary.raw:
Refactor the `_github_setup` to only create the github local checkout and use a new `_github_get_formula_hash` to keep the previous behaviour working.

I changed the `homebrew_bottle_pullrequest` script to iterate over the json files and call the commit on each one. PACKAGE_ALIAS and VERSION have been overwritten by the json variables.
summary.html:
Refactor the _github_setup to only create the github local checkout and use a new _github_get_formula_hash to keep the previous behaviour working.

I changed the homebrew_bottle_pullrequest script to iterate over the json files and call the commit on each one. PACKAGE_ALIAS and VERSION have been overwritten by the json variables.

values.description:
The recent sdformat4 release generated [osrf/simulation pull request 150](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/150), but the [bottle build failed](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/100/) during the `brew audit` step because of the leftover formula revision.

This PR removes formula revisions when releasing a new version of a package. I decline that previous PR in order to test this branch from start to finish in [pr 151](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/151), and the [bottle build was successful](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/102/).
values.title: Remove formula revision when releasing a new version

summary.raw:
The recent sdformat4 release generated [osrf/simulation pull request 150](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/150), but the [bottle build failed](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/100/) during the `brew audit` step because of the leftover formula revision.

This PR removes formula revisions when releasing a new version of a package. I decline that previous PR in order to test this branch from start to finish in [pr 151](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/151), and the [bottle build was successful](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/102/).
summary.html:
The recent sdformat4 release generated osrf/simulation pull request 150, but the bottle build failed during the brew audit step because of the leftover formula revision.

This PR removes formula revisions when releasing a new version of a package. I decline that previous PR in order to test this branch from start to finish in pr 151, and the bottle build was successful.

values.description:
In this PR:

 * DSL definition for debbuild and CI packages for srcsim and ihmc-valkyrie-ros
 * Testing jobs for package installations
 * Special debbuild script since it needs the external repo

Testing:

  * [srcsim debbuild](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/srcsim-debbuilder/) and [ihmc debbuild](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ihmc_valkyrie_ros-debbuilder/).
  * [srcsim installation](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/srcim-install_pkg-trusty-amd64/)

values.description: A homewbrew regression caused a failed build today. Fortunately, they are now tagging versions of `homebrew/brew`, and you can set the `HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG` environment variable to get improved stability.
values.title: set HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG in brew scripts to improve stability

summary.raw: A homewbrew regression caused a failed build today. Fortunately, they are now tagging versions of `homebrew/brew`, and you can set the `HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG` environment variable to get improved stability.

values.description:
Fix quoting in ignition homebrew script, and duplicate logic for default branch in additon to ci-pr_any. Also, set `SCRIPT_DIR` in project-*homebrew script  so it can be called directly.

Bottom line: [ignition-msgs on homebrew is blue](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/20)! and [ignition-math is still blue too](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/ignition_math-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/48), so I think this didn't break existing jobs.

* Fix quoting in ign brew ci-pr_any jobs

* Use generic script for ci-default if specialized one doesn't exist

* Set SCRIPT_DIR for homebrew project script if it isn't already set

* chop of extra lib from SCRIPT_DIR if set inside project script
values.title: More ignition CI on homebrew

summary.raw:
Fix quoting in ignition homebrew script, and duplicate logic for default branch in additon to ci-pr_any. Also, set `SCRIPT_DIR` in project-*homebrew script  so it can be called directly.

Bottom line: [ignition-msgs on homebrew is blue](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/20)! and [ignition-math is still blue too](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/ignition_math-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/48), so I think this didn't break existing jobs.

* Fix quoting in ign brew ci-pr_any jobs

* Use generic script for ci-default if specialized one doesn't exist

* Set SCRIPT_DIR for homebrew project script if it isn't already set

* chop of extra lib from SCRIPT_DIR if set inside project script
summary.html:
Fix quoting in ignition homebrew script, and duplicate logic for default branch in additon to ci-pr_any. Also, set SCRIPT_DIR in project-*homebrew script so it can be called directly.

Bottom line: ignition-msgs on homebrew is blue! and ignition-math is still blue too, so I think this didn't break existing jobs.

  • Fix quoting in ign brew ci-pr_any jobs

  • Use generic script for ci-default if specialized one doesn't exist

  • Set SCRIPT_DIR for homebrew project script if it isn't already set

  • chop of extra lib from SCRIPT_DIR if set inside project script

values.title: Enable test suite compilation explicitly in gazebo
Improve email filtering for contributors outside OSRF

summary.html:
Extend the filtering to the CC and BCC just to be sure.

Include a debug message to be sure that the filtering is being run. I suspect that there are some cases where the filtering is not being done because a problem with the java heap appeared somehow and kill the processing of the pre-hook in the email-ext.

//cc @cirosantilli

values.description:
The ign-msgs build on windows was broken. This PR should fix the compilation. It needed some touches to the default building script so I run ign-math script to be sure that we are not breaking anything.

* [ign-math testing run](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/187/)

values.description:
I don't know what changed, but the homebrew one-line install script for gazebo doesn't have `/usr/local/bin` in the `PATH` anymore, so the script was unable to find the `brew` command.

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64/328

I've added it in this pull request.

Note that testing this requires changing the test script (like in 4bae3b5, which was [tested here](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64/330/)).

I'm not sure if we need additional messaging to the user about adjusting their environment. I'll merge this PR now to fix jenkins, but please comment if we should adjust the messaging.
values.title: add /usr/local/bin to PATH in gazebo homebrew install script

summary.raw:
I don't know what changed, but the homebrew one-line install script for gazebo doesn't have `/usr/local/bin` in the `PATH` anymore, so the script was unable to find the `brew` command.

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64/328

I've added it in this pull request.

Note that testing this requires changing the test script (like in 4bae3b5, which was [tested here](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64/330/)).

I'm not sure if we need additional messaging to the user about adjusting their environment. I'll merge this PR now to fix jenkins, but please comment if we should adjust the messaging.
summary.html:
I don't know what changed, but the homebrew one-line install script for gazebo doesn't have /usr/local/bin in the PATH anymore, so the script was unable to find the brew command.

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64/328

I've added it in this pull request.

Note that testing this requires changing the test script (like in 4bae3b5, which was tested here).

I'm not sure if we need additional messaging to the user about adjusting their environment. I'll merge this PR now to fix jenkins, but please comment if we should adjust the messaging.

values.description:
Remove the custom code that mimic the X stack, in both the host and the docker container, and replace it by the [nvidia-docker software](https://github.com/NVIDIA/nvidia-docker). It brings the nice feature that we can run any version of Ubuntu on every host independently of which nvidia drivers is the host running or the Ubuntu version being tested.

Tested in a Xenial system:

   * [Xenial gazebo build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia_test/21/)
   * [Trusty gazebo build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia_test/1/)
values.title: Use nvidia-docker integration for nvidia builds

summary.raw:
Remove the custom code that mimic the X stack, in both the host and the docker container, and replace it by the [nvidia-docker software](https://github.com/NVIDIA/nvidia-docker). It brings the nice feature that we can run any version of Ubuntu on every host independently of which nvidia drivers is the host running or the Ubuntu version being tested.

Tested in a Xenial system:

   * [Xenial gazebo build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia_test/21/)
   * [Trusty gazebo build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia_test/1/)
summary.html:
Remove the custom code that mimic the X stack, in both the host and the docker container, and replace it by the nvidia-docker software. It brings the nice feature that we can run any version of Ubuntu on every host independently of which nvidia drivers is the host running or the Ubuntu version being tested.

Tested in a Xenial system:

  • Xenial gazebo build
  • Trusty gazebo build

values.description:
I copied the bottle builder job and changed the label to point at [osx_elcapitan](http://build.osrfoundation.org/label/osx_elcapitan/). We should figure out a way to trigger builds on separate machines.

See [bot.brew.sh](https://bot.brew.sh/job/Homebrew%20Core/13545/) for an example configuration.

One manually triggered job:

values.description:
There is one new dependency for ign-core: libgflags-dev

If it is not installed then cmake will report the following error

```
#!

-- BUILD ERRORS: These must be resolved before compiling.
--      GFlags package is missing.
-- END BUILD ERRORS

```
values.title: Added IGN_CORE_DEPENDENCIES

values.description:
Some homebrew builds have been failing recently with the following error message:

~~~
+++ export HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG=1
+++ HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG=1
+++ /usr/local/bin/brew update
Error: Another active Homebrew update process is already in progress.
Please wait for it to finish or terminate it to continue.
Build step 'Execute shell' marked build as failure
~~~

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo7-homebrew-amd64/118/console

I was able to reproduce this failure locally on the test machine, but only after setting the `HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG` variable to 1. After reading a [github issue](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/issues/1155#issuecomment-249688363), I saw that it was related to `git gc` breaking the state of the brew repo. A `git fsck` is enough to fix it; so I've added that to our CI scripts. Here's a test build with this branch:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo7-homebrew-amd64/119/
values.title: Do `git fsck` before `brew up` in case gc broke things
